Getting Started: HemOnc Example

Source: vignettes/getting-started.Rmd
getting-started.Rmd

Last Update On: 2021-08-28 11:43:51

OMOP Vocabulary Loaded At: 2021-06-18 21:32:34
OMOP Vocabulary Release Version: v5.0 17-JUN-21
HemOnc: NA 
library(chariotViz)

ChariotViz visualizes all valid Concepts at the Concept Class level by either properties represented by the CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP table or by traversing direct relationships via the CONCEPT_ANCESTOR table.

OMOP Relationships are fetched from the CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP table with corresponding annotations from the CONCEPT table.

omop_relationships <- 
  fetch_omop_relationships(version_key = get_version_key())
#> ℹ Getting total concept class counts
#> ✓ Getting total concept class counts [531ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Getting total vocabulary counts
#> ✓ Getting total vocabulary counts [544ms]
#> 
#> Querying UB04 Pt dis status Relationships | ■■■■■■■■■■                       34…
#> Querying MeSH Relationships | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■            78/117  67% (4.5…
#> Querying RxNorm Extension Relationships | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■  117/…
#> 
#> Calculating UB04 Pt dis status Concept Class Counts | ■■■■■■■■■■               …
#> Calculating ICD9Proc Concept Class Counts | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■               65…
#> Calculating RxNorm Extension Concept Class Counts | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■…
#> 
omop_relationships
#> ══ OMOP Data ═══════════════════════════════════════════════
#>  relationship_id                   relationship_name relationship_source
#>      Mapped from Standard to Non-standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#>         Subsumes                            Subsumes                <NA>
#>         Subsumes                            Subsumes                <NA>
#>  is_hierarchical defines_ancestry domain_id_1 vocabulary_id_1
#>                0                0    Provider        Supplier
#>                1                1    Provider        Supplier
#>                1                1    Provider        Supplier
#>  concept_class_id_1 standard_concept_1 concept_count_1 total_concept_class_ct_1
#>            Provider                  S               1                        1
#>            Provider                  S               1                        1
#>            Provider                  S               1                        1
#>  total_vocabulary_ct_1 domain_id_2    vocabulary_id_2  concept_class_id_2
#>                      1    Provider Medicare Specialty Physician Specialty
#>                      1       Visit Medicare Specialty               Visit
#>                      1       Visit               NUCC               Visit
#>  standard_concept_2 concept_count_2 total_concept_class_ct_2
#>                <NA>               1                       68
#>                   S              13                       30
#>                   S              14                      179
#>  total_vocabulary_ct_2
#>                    116
#>                    116
#>                    845
#> ...9027 more rows

This dataframe is then converted to a subset of 2 dataframes of nodes and edges.

omop_nodes_and_edges <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(omop_relationships = omop_relationships)

omop_nodes_and_edges
#> ══ Nodes ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════

Prior to visualization, a tooltip and attributes are added.

omop_nodes_and_edges <- 
  omop_nodes_and_edges %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>%
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes()

The graph is constructed.

omop_graph <- 
  construct_graph(omop_nodes_and_edges)
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `id`.
omop_graph
#> ══ Graph ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════
#> DiagrammeR Graph // 650 nodes / 9030 edges
#>   -- directed / disconnected / property graph
#> 
#>   NODES / type: 258 vals - complete / label: 440 vals - complete
#>     -- 15 additional node attributes (domain_id, vocabulary_id, concept_class_id + 12 more)
#>   EDGES / rel: 468 vals - complete                         info: `get_edge_df()`
#>     -- 27 additional edge attributes (label, relationship_id, relationship_name + 24 more)
#>   SELECTION / <none>
#>   CACHE / <none>
#>   GLOBAL ATTRS / 18 are set                 info: `get_global_graph_attr_info()`
#>   GRAPH ACTIONS / <none>
#>   GRAPH LOG / () -> ()
#> 
#> ══ Status ══════════════════════════════════════════════════
#> ✓ Tooltip:       TRUE
#> ✓ Node Attributes:   TRUE
#> ✓ Edge Attributes:   TRUE
#> x Example Concepts:  FALSE

The above is a graph of the entire OMOP Vocabularies in its present state.

chariotViz(omop_graph = omop_graph)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                    650      9030  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#> There are 650 nodes and 9030 edges.
#> To render anyways, set `force` to TRUE.

Due to the large number of nodes, the graph is not rendered, but can be forced to do so by setting force to TRUE.

Specific sets of vocabularies can be isolated by filtering the omop.relationships class object prior to conversion to nodes and edges.

Here, we are filtering for relationships within the HemOnc vocabulary only.

hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc",
    vocabulary_id_2 == "HemOnc"
  )

The HemOnc graph is constructed after it is filtered for.

hemonc_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()
#> ══ 
#> Node Attributes ════════════════════════════════════════
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           square   
#>                               S           circle   
#>                               NA          circle   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           filled   
#>                               S           filled   
#>                               NA          filled

#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept

With a smaller node count, chariotViz will automatically render the graph.

chariotViz(hemonc_graph)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                     10        52  
#>                              ─────────────────────

The fillcolor of the nodes can be remapped.

hemonc_graph2 <- 
  hemonc_graph %>% 
  remap_fillcolor_by_concept_class()
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `id`.

#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `id`.
#> ✓ All 10 unique values mapped:
#>                       ───────────────────────────────────
#>                         Attribute         Value          
#>                       ───────────────────────────────────
#>                         Brand Name        violetred2     
#>                         Brand Name        darkorange     
#>                         Component         maroon2        
#>                         Component Class   maroon4        
#>                         Condition         thistle        
#>                         Context           lightcyan      
#>                         Modality          lightseagreen  
#>                         Procedure         cyan           
#>                         Regimen           dodgerblue2    
#>                         Regimen Class     dodgerblue4    
#>                         Route             red            
#>                       ───────────────────────────────────

chariotViz(hemonc_graph2)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                     10        52  
#>                              ─────────────────────

Relationships

The relationships can also be filtered based on 3 classes of relationships: Taxonomy, Mapping, or Lateral. These classes are not defined by OHDSI and are specific to the chariot and chariotViz packages.

Taxonomy

Taxonomy relationships are relationships that represent a hierarchy (Is a and Subsumes).

hemonc_taxonomy_relationships <- 
  hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_taxonomy_relationships() 

hemonc_taxonomy_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_taxonomy_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph() %>% 
  remap_fillcolor_by_concept_class()
#> ══ 
#> Node Attributes ════════════════════════════════════════
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           square   
#>                               S           circle   
#>                               NA          circle   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           filled

           height = 500,
           width = 500)
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                      4         4  
#>                              ─────────────────────

Mapping

Mapping relationships are relationships that represent a mapping from a source to target, as in the case of an ETLing into the OMOP CDM. Since we filtered for concepts within HemOnc, the filter returns zero relationships since the basis of these relationships is mapping between different vocabularies.

hemonc_mapping_relationships <- 
  hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_mapping_relationships() 

hemonc_mapping_relationships
#> ══ OMOP Data ═══════════════════════════════════════════════
#>  [1] relationship_id          relationship_name        relationship_source     
#>  [4] is_hierarchical          defines_ancestry         domain_id_1             
#>  [7] vocabulary_id_1          concept_class_id_1       standard_concept_1      
#> [10] concept_count_1          total_concept_class_ct_1 total_vocabulary_ct_1   
#> [13] domain_id_2              vocabulary_id_2          concept_class_id_2      
#> [16] standard_concept_2       concept_count_2          total_concept_class_ct_2
#> [19] total_vocabulary_ct_2   
#> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)
#> ...-3 more rows

To view HemOnc’s mapping relationships, we can re-filter the original object for HemOnc on side 1 only.

all_hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc")

hemonc_mapping_relationships <- 
  all_hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_mapping_relationships() 

hemonc_mapping_relationships
#> ══ OMOP Data ═══════════════════════════════════════════════
#>  relationship_id                   relationship_name relationship_source
#>          Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#>          Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#>          Maps to Non-standard to Standard map (OMOP)                OMOP
#>  is_hierarchical defines_ancestry domain_id_1 vocabulary_id_1
#>                0                0   Condition          HemOnc
#>                0                0   Condition          HemOnc
#>                0                0        Drug          HemOnc
#>  concept_class_id_1 standard_concept_1 concept_count_1 total_concept_class_ct_1
#>           Condition               <NA>               1                      219
#>           Condition               <NA>             142                      219
#>           Component               <NA>               2                      629
#>  total_vocabulary_ct_1 domain_id_2 vocabulary_id_2 concept_class_id_2
#>                   7325   Condition           ICDO3     ICDO Condition
#>                   7325   Condition          SNOMED   Clinical Finding
#>                   7325        Drug          RxNorm  Branded Drug Form
#>  standard_concept_2 concept_count_2 total_concept_class_ct_2
#>                   S               1                    59757
#>                   S             139                   131787
#>                   S               2                    13648
#>  total_vocabulary_ct_2
#>                  61359
#>                 750918
#>                 200077
#> ...3 more rows

We can now see how HemOnc maps to other OMOP vocabularies.

hemonc_mapping_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_mapping_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph() 
#> ══ 
#> Node Attributes ════════════════════════════════════════
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               S           circle   
#>                               NA          circle   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               S           filled   
#>                               NA          filled   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          white    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 5 unique values mapped:
#>                       ────────────────────────────────────
#>                         Attribute          Value          
#>                       ────────────────────────────────────
#>                         HemOnc             cadetblue2     
#>                         ICDO3              peachpuff2     
#>                         RxNorm             deeppink2      
#>                         RxNorm Extension   mistyrose2     
#>                         SNOMED             lightskyblue2  
#>                       ────────────────────────────────────
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          gray40

chariotViz(hemonc_mapping_graph)

#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────

#>                              ─────────────────────

Lateral

Lateral relationships are relationships that are all other relationships. Returning to the relationships within HemOnc, the lateral relationships are filtered for.

hemonc_lateral_relationships <- 
  hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_lateral_relationships()

hemonc_lateral_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_lateral_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph() 
#> ══ 
#> Node Attributes ════════════════════════════════════════
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           square   
#>                               S           circle   
#>                               NA          circle   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           filled   
#>                               S           filled   
#>                               NA          filled   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           black    
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          white    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped:
#>                            ──────────────────────────
#>                              Attribute   Value       
#>                            ──────────────────────────
#>                              HemOnc      cadetblue2  
#>                            ──────────────────────────
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           black    
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          gray40

#>                               1           bold     
#>                               0           solid

#> ! 1 value not mapped: Hemonc. Mapping to `other` value 'black'.

With the relationships within and outside of HemOnc, the all_hemonc_relationships returns the following graph.

  all_hemonc_relationships %>% 
  filter_for_lateral_relationships()

  create_nodes_and_edges(hemonc_lateral_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()

Foreign

To retrieve any relationships outside of HemOnc instead, the original omop_relationships object must be filtered once more, but this time with exclusion of HemOnc in the filter.

foreign_hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc",
    vocabulary_id_2 != "HemOnc") %>% 
  filter_for_lateral_relationships() 

foreign_hemonc_lateral_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(foreign_hemonc_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()
#> ══ 
#> Node Attributes ════════════════════════════════════════
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────

#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               S           circle   
#>                               NA          circle   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               S           filled   
#>                               NA          filled   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          white    
#>                             ───────────────────────

#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:

Filtering for Taxonomy relationships allows visualization of how ancestry of a vocabulary relates to other vocabularies. Here, it is evident that only HemOnc’s Component Class is a parent to RxNorm and RxNorm Extension Concept Classes.

foreign_hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc",
    vocabulary_id_2 != "HemOnc") %>% 
  filter_for_taxonomy_relationships() 

foreign_hemonc_taxonomy_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(foreign_hemonc_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()
#> ══ 
#> Node Attributes ════════════════════════════════════════
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           square   
#>                               S           circle   
#>                               NA          circle   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           filled   
#>                               S           filled   
#>                               NA          filled   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           black    
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          white    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                        ─────────────────────────────────
#>                          Attribute          Value       
#>                        ─────────────────────────────────
#>                          HemOnc             cadetblue2  
#>                          RxNorm             deeppink2   
#>                          RxNorm Extension   mistyrose2  
#>                        ─────────────────────────────────
#> ℹ Fontcolor from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           black    
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          gray40   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               1           bold     
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               NA          black    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ✓ All 1 unique value mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               1           2        
#>                             ───────────────────────

#>                             ───────────────────────

chariotViz(foreign_hemonc_taxonomy_graph)

#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                      6         5

To view all possible foreign relationships, the filter can be lifted.

foreign_hemonc_relationships <- 
  omop_relationships %>% 
  filter_omop_relationships(
    vocabulary_id_1 == "HemOnc",
    vocabulary_id_2 != "HemOnc") #%>% 
#  filter_for_lateral_relationships() 

foreign_hemonc_graph <- 
  create_nodes_and_edges(foreign_hemonc_relationships) %>% 
  add_tooltip() %>% 
  map_node_attributes() %>% 
  map_edge_attributes() %>% 
  construct_graph()
#> ══ 
#> Node Attributes ════════════════════════════════════════
#> ℹ Shape from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           square   
#>                               S           circle   
#>                               NA          circle   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Style from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           filled   
#>                               S           filled   
#>                               NA          filled   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Color from: standard_concept
#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:

#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           black    
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          white    
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ Fillcolor from: vocabulary_id
#> ✓ All 5 unique values mapped:

#>                         Attribute          Value          
#>                       ────────────────────────────────────
#>                         HemOnc             cadetblue2

#> ✓ All 3 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────

#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               C           black    
#>                               S           black    
#>                               NA          gray40   
#>                             ───────────────────────
#> ℹ 3 constant attributes added: fontsize, width, and height.
#> ✓ All 2 unique values mapped:
#>                             ───────────────────────
#>                               Attribute   Value

Visualizing Concepts

Samples of concepts along with a tooltip containing the concept’s attribute values can be appended to the graph with the append_concept_examples function.

foreign_hemonc_graph %>% 
  append_concept_examples(sample_size = 3) %>% 
  chariotViz(force = TRUE,
             width = 1500)
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `id`.

#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `id`.
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                n nodes   n edges  
#>                              ─────────────────────
#>                                     44        53  
#>                              ─────────────────────

The count of the samples can be adjusted.

foreign_hemonc_graph %>% 
  append_concept_examples(sample_size = 5) %>% 
  chariotViz(force = TRUE,
             width = 1500)
foreign_hemonc_graph %>% 
  append_concept_examples(sample_size = 10) %>% 
  chariotViz(force = TRUE,
             height = 2000)
